ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1.5 hours on average every week (though a few weeks throughout the semester we did not have a speaker).
The weekly response takes about three hours to finish reading and writing.
none

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very good speakers. Very engaging seminar.
Excellent speakers!

It's great, but think ahead. Please don't schedule one on the thursday before we take the last of our exams where we had three in a row. I get that its not possible to know the schedule for finals when making arrangements, so just don't make it during finals week.
Improvement: It would be great to try to not schedule speakers before the holidays or during finals.

I would prefer more variety in the speakers. Many seem geared toward the management side of things, when true leadership should not be conflated with 'successful' management of multimillion-dollar establishments. Some of the clinicians and policy purists in the room feel that the course does not adequately acknowledge the morality, ethics, and compassion of leadership. I certainly have learned important lessons from the speakers, but would appreciate the class further challenging our conceptions of leadership by inviting leaders in non-profits, government, and think tanks rather than private industry.

Strengths: -Incredible opportunity to hear perspectives of leaders/practitioners in the field and gain access to direct conversations with them. -Good survey of potential career paths in healthcare management. -Speakers from hospital administration and policy were well-represented. Weaknesses: -Could have had more speakers of color, more diverse representation. -Would have been nice to have a speaker with clear focus on social justice.
Good diversity of speakers. Better when there are less students in the room.
I loved learning from individuals who are at the heights of their fields, and getting different perspectives on what is being done and needs to be done to the healthcare system.

I look forward to this colloquium every week. The speakers come from so many different backgrounds in healthcare and open our eyes to so many different aspects. This is by far one of the most rewarding experiences in the program. The exposure we get and the ideas we learn from these accomplished speakers are priceless.
Thanks for letting us introduce ourselves.

I wish there were more women speakers, especially considering how many women are in the cohort of students! I really appreciate the diversity of speakers, especially the fact that we had a republican! I think it's easy for the students to think that our bubble represents the country, but it certainly doesn't. There are a lot of republicans out there and it's important that the outspoken democrats learn to have productive, non judgmental conversations.
Excellent listening to guest speakers.
Course was good. Would like to see different types of professional backgrounds, and not only MDs. In addition, the course should feature speakers who work in different types of communities.
Wonderful - I'm so glad we have this opportunity. I would go to every session even if it was not for credit.
Great! We are given the opportunity to learn from a variety of speakers across the healthcare industry.

It is a wonderful supplement to the traditional YSPH coursework and provides a clear opportunity to see first hands ways in which the skills we acquire at YSPH can be applied in a a diverse set of professional settings.
Excellent. Very bipartisan and multifaceted representation of health management, policy, leadership and practice.
A chance to meet some of the leaders in the industry? Why not!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great professor!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie has no weaknesses!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Dr. Forman is a phenomenal facilitator for this experience and is the primary reason why I'm at Yale.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great at facilitating conversation.

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie was great at moderating the conversations, bringing in good speakers, and was overall fantastic at running this course. Looking forward to taking additional courses with him.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Brings in excellent speakers.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  I appreciate the diversity of speakers. Can we PLEASE have more WOMEN. Especially NON-Doctor WOMEN. THANKS!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Excellent professor.

Instructor: Howard P Forman  I'm so glad we have this opportunity to learn from others in the healthcare industry. This is one of many examples of Howie going above and beyond in making this program so wonderful. Although there has obviously been a lot of diversity in terms of the sectors and job roles representing, I'd like it if there were a greater proportion of non-white male speakers.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great Professor!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is an incredible mentor and it is clear he genuinely cares about his students and helping to advance their careers / develop them professionally.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is an incredibly brilliant, kind and thoughtful professor. Keep it up, Howie!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie's network is truly impressive. It's so nice that he brings these great speakers to talk with us.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You meet and hear from healthcare experts at different stages of their careers. Really great course overall! Definitely take it!
Interesting talks would recommend
Yes, it is great to hear from healthcare leaders in the industry.
This is the best course you'll take in your first semester here.
This is not a course to miss. If its optional, take it. Learning how the healthcare system works is necessary to developing your career.
This is awesome. Come. Be engaged. Learn something. Gain perspective
This course provides the amazing opportunity to learn from leaders in the health care management field.
Excellent!
Very useful

IF you want to be a leader in healthcare, then you should listen to Howie's speakers. Not to mention, every speaker has the utmost respect for Howie and if you take advantage of the course resources, you might get a job offer!
If you're going to learn, why not learn from the best. Truly humbling to be in the same room and hear from the magnates of healthcare
